Reviews.Title: “Janis Joplan died here....We Know why”
Reviews.Author: Allessio77
Reviews.Content: The art and science of hostelry is centuries old. This hotel missed all the main advancements. It's too bad, for the location and the size of the rooms are very nice. But here are a few of the things this hotel DOES NOT have or is a problem: 1. Ice and Ice buckets--none in sight. 2. An Alarm clock--This is the first hotel I have been in without a clock radio. 3. Pens and Memo pads. 4. A flatscreen TV. It had a 19 inch tube TV. (with Bad cable picture) 5. A shower an adult can fit in....there's was 24" x 24" 6. Mircowave cord could not reach a socket...we had to put it on the floor! 7. Shower head at neck level--try to wash your hair in a 4" sq ahower! 8. As cheap of furniture as possible.....tops lifting due to a coke bottles sweating. 9. Rusted out shower door hinges. 10. Wobbly, misfit shower water valves and handles. 11. Rusted out shower drain. 12. Standard toilet...not elongated like most hotel toilets. Brand new btw, and an elongated would have plenty of room, but there were too cheap to spend another 30 dollars. 13. Smallest bar (?) of soap from China that I have ever seen. No lotions, mouth wash, etc 14. 8" thick mattress. (most are 12,14, or 16") 15. No desk, no chairs...only two Kitchen chairs (sans kitchen). 16. Outlets without covers. 17. The hallway to the room was dim, dank and dark. Picture a 30's NYC tenement. 18. Very thin towels. 19. No FREE internet. 20. Water in pool unheated and unusable. 21. No place in bath to place cosmetics. No shelves. Everything had to be placed in a medicine cabinet (retail value $22.00) 22. Disk clerk on phone with BF for extended periods of time. This place has NO decor, and is so dirty as to wonder why they clean at all. When we booked, at had been 5 years since I last stayed here, and I thought they may have made some improvements. No dice. Stay at your your own risk! You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel needs some work!”
Reviews.Author: msrosieposie
Reviews.Content: mold in the shower - wouldn't be too difficult to clean. the cleaners obviously don't step into the shower, otherwise they would see it by the door. no wheelchair access - my mother who had a broken foot had to crawl up entrance stairs. uncomfortable pillows - felt like i was sleeping on a 20 year old cushion. the pictures looked nice! the rooms need to be remodeled like the reception area has been

Reviews.Title: “A great find, if you know what you are doing”
Reviews.Author: mrsammar
Reviews.Content: This hotel feels like a garden sanctuary once you are beyond the lobby, and you'd never know you were just a block away from the hustle-and-bustle of Hollywood. As a member of the Magic Castle, I have stayed here many times to be walking distance to the Castle. I was delighted to see the lobby and many of the rooms have been renovated. I stayed in a 1 bedroom suite and really enjoyed the room (ask for the ones that face West. They are sunnier, often have private balconies and vaulted ceilings). I especially like rooms 217 - 221. We had a beautiful kitchen, full living room, table for 4 inside and out, renovated white bathroom with pedestal sink, and the bedroom was roomy with a large walk-in closet (and a nice view of the pool and mountains). Each day when we would come in, the room was freshly cleaned and smelled good. Breakfast is just continental, expect coffee, some type of bread to toast, jelly / cream cheese. Hot cocoa was available too and some juice boxes if you have kids. We almost stayed on Sunset Blvd and I'm so glad we didn't - because we would have had a MUCH higher bill. Here we didn't pay for parking, we could get a soda or water for a dollar, Wifi is just $10 day and free in the lobby, the room was twice as big as average. I have found if you need something, just ask - they'll give you extra towels, loan you a hair dryer, and Marie can likely arrange for you to get a pass to the Magic Castle (try Sunday Brunch). Also a bonus is what is nearby. It's just a block to the Kodak Theatre and the mall over there - lots of food and shopping (Sephora, Mac, Victoria's Secret, CVS, California Pizza Kitchen, Cirque du Soliel, Walk of Fame, etc). And behind the hotel you go up to Yamashiro and have the best view in LA. (The hotel is on the Hollywood tour because it is where Janis Joplin died - so you might be able to catch the tour at the hotel, I'm not sure). Also nearby is a big, mountainous public park where you can hike and enjoy the day. I'll stay again and continue to stay. The hotel is dated on the exterior, but I like that old Hollywood 60's look. Just remember the rooms can vary a lot in size and how they feel inside. Ask to see a few before you pick one.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my.”
Reviews.Author: GenCo101
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels. This was close to the all time worst I've stayed in in 25 years of traveling. I paid for an "executive suite" thinking I'd get a renovated room. When I asked the front desk person, she said, "they're all renovated." When I got to the room, if I hadn't already paid for 3 nights, I would have turned around & walked out! The bedspreads, nightstand & dresser were "updated." The shower tile, sink & toilet were "updated." But, the bathroom & kitchenette windows were very old & not secure. The huge sliding glass door that opened to the walkway barely locked, the chewed up gap across the bottom of the door to the room was so wide, critters would barely have to sqeeze to get through. There were multiple mouse traps & "droppings" in the kitchen. The lamp shades looked like they'd been tossed around a few times. The clean towels & wash cloths were still damp. The good news is, when I checked for bedbugs, I did not find any evidence of them. What I don't understand is, when I walked across the property to my friend's "executive suite," it was like they were in a different hotel - - it was fully updated - - like a real hotel! The hotel staff were pleasant. The continental breakfast by the front desk every morning was adequate. The proximity to Hollywood Blvd attractions is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Old dirty little HollyHood hotel with no luxeries what so ever.Nasty nasty!”
Reviews.Author: wickedpoodle
Reviews.Content: This is a dirty little hotel with guetto cleaning ladies that are laughing an talking loud first thing in the morning. The tv was as big as a portable radio and just about everything in the room was broken in some way. No hair dryer, ice, or wet bar. The breakfast is never there on time and is cold. The coffee is disgusting and the cream was sour. The female receptionist was rude and acted bothered everytime I asked her for something even though all she does all day is it around on her butt. If you want to impress someone this isn't the place. If you don't want to stay in a hostell and are totally broke with no standards then this is the place for you. This is a nasty little hotel and looks like a place porno movies would be filmed! Never again! Gross!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Looked nice from the outside...”
Reviews.Author: lauraisrad
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the positive reviews, it's obvious that the quality of this hotel varies drastically room to room. We, unfortunately, got a terrible one. The headboards on both beds were leaning in and looked as though they'd fall on top of us. The table and chairs were in the same shabby/wobbly condition. The carpet was dingy and puckered up, and the shelf in the shower was missing. But it wasn't just that the place was old - it was also dirty. The carpet had not been vacuumed very well and one of the chairs had a huge stain on the seat. As others have said, the location is great, the parking is free, and the garden/patio areas are nice, but none of that makes up for the outrageous condition of the room. Don't risk it - spend a few extra bucks and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “My new go-to hotel in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Kreskin2207
Reviews.Content: Love this place. I think this is going to be my go-to hotel in LA from now on. It's in a good central location and the staff was friendly. This place has a younger clientele from what I saw so I'm sure it gets louder on the weekends. Things were perfectly great for us on a Monday however. I'm not going to say I didn't do a good bit of partying myself, so maybe the neighbors had a problem....but we heard no complaints. There's parking in a locked garage under the hotel, the lobby area is renovated, the pool area was clean and inviting. We had a nice little patio area outside our first floor room which put us in perfect location to the pool. I loved this place, but as others state, it can be a party hotel. It's and old school LA party hotel what do you expect. Hey, Janis Joplin died here for God's sake! But its a clean hotel, I thought the management was nice and friendly, and its a good location and price. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: SusanD8
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel by reading the review on tripadvisor. Only rated a few stars, but the reviews were good and the price was right. A single mom with 4 children , the area seemed safe before the 9pm hour. The suite was very clean, but had a slight "old" odor as it is very vintage. Ran into a few problems but the staff and manager was very accomadating. Small continental breakfast was available every morn. This hotel was the perfect location if you want to take in all of Hollywood Blvd. A short few blocks to the blvd, subway , bus and tours. If you want to save lots of $$, I suggest you go to the tourism booth by the Kodak Theatre and get a bus schedule to everywhere. For $1.50 you can go to Rodeo Dr, Venice Beach, CBS Sudios and the list goes on & on...

Reviews.Title: “Scary lack of maintenance”
Reviews.Author: asdasdadadasdas
Reviews.Content: I usually rarely complain much about hotel rooms, but this place really took the price. When we came to check in the front desk guy reminded us that we would be getting the "not yet remodeled room", and claimed we already had been notified about that. No where did we see this mentioned when we booked the hotel room or was told about that. We went up to look at the room, and it was disgusting and looked like a room that hadn't seen maintenance or updating in 50 years. It smelled like the doors and windows had been closed for just as long. We complained about this room, because it was in a completely unacceptable unliveable state. I've never in my life seen as bad a room as this (and I've been to some shady places in my life). We got moved to a remodeled room. While this was better, the state of this room is what I would have been expecting from a room that's "not yet remodeled". There were several items that were more or less broken. Not so broken that it didn't work, but so broken that I would never rent out a room in that state. Generally it felt like nothing is repaired until it's completely broken. Electrical outlets was missing cover plates, wires were coming out of the walls, the aircondition cover was knocked half-way off and had a power cable across the floor to an uncovered outlet. Holes in the ceiling, termite infested walls. Several of these things are as far as I know illegal! The iron was missing, and I requested one. One was fairly quickly delivered, but it had burnmarks on the bottom (would have left ugly stains on your clothes). I filled it with water and plugged it in, and minutes later noticed that the water was pouring out and down the wire. I got this replaced with a completely new one, but it's a good example of the hotel only replacing stuff when it gets completely broken, and not fixing stuff that's dangerous or unpresentable. Some things had been fixed, but done in a way where there was lots of original (old) interior, combined with new replaced cheap stuff which wasn't true to the original interior (which is a shame because this could have made it a really cool 70s style hotel). I would NOT stay there EVER again. Who ever manages this hotel it cutting so many corners, that he/she should be banned from running anything building-related.

Reviews.Title: “First time stay and will return”
Reviews.Author: allredb
Reviews.Content: This is an older property probably built in the 60's. If you are looking for luxury this is not the place. The rooms are dated and the bathrooms small but the room was clean. The location is great if you are planning activities around Hollywood Blvd. The young man at the front desk was very helpful with directions and recommendations for places to eat. We will be returning in August and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great stay here.”
Reviews.Author: monessen
Reviews.Content: I had only expected to spend one night here, in a ground floor room. This room was fine however after a single night I decieded it was o.k. to perhaps book the rest of my stay here. I got room 221 from May 6th to the 17th, a two bedroom suite. The room was painted all white which made it quite bright. Since I had decided to give this property my business, the manager showed me around and gave me an attractive reduction on the room rate. There was a full kitchen at my disposal and everything worked fine. All the staff I came in contact with were helpful and pleasant. I am not fussy about alot of things except for the room being clean which this was. It also had a huge balcony which was nice in the evenings. Free parking was also a huge plus in a city that loves it's parking charges. As for what others have noted, it all depends on what they are looking for . Yes this hotel is old, yes the rooms vary, and yes sometimes if you are rude or worse dishonest, the staff may not be as friendly. My time here was delightful, the staff just fine and the manager treated me like a valued resident, what more could I ask for. I will return to this hotel without a second thought!

Reviews.Title: “After the Lobby everything went downhill!!”
Reviews.Author: samspain
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel looked OK from the outside and it had been refurbished in the lobby but everything else was dirty and tired, hated the bedrooms,they felt stale and the carpet looked ancient.Not cheap either there is only one redeeming feature the location is great and the staff were very pleasant. Free limited parking don't move or you'll lose your place. Try somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for all of Hollywood's Attractions”
Reviews.Author: wcub
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a ground-floor, courtyard-facing room with a miniature porch, which made it nice and quiet (Franklin is a very busy street with a lot of fast traffice). Hummingbirds, squirrels and other critters enjoying the mature foliage made our stay quite pleasant! The clean lobby is pure mid-century modern, architecturally-speaking. If this is your thing, then you will love the design. Internet / WiFi is *not* complimentary here. We had assumed that WiFi would be free in the lobby, but a five minute walk to Starbucks takes care of that need. Small breakfast items are included (bagels, bread, muffins, coffee, etc.) in the little breakfast nook off the front desk. Nothing too special about it, but nice to have as no coffee maker was in our room. You can easily walk to Hollywood Boulevard, Kodak Theatre, Grauman's Chinese Theatre, and the Hollywood/Western subway station, but Franklin Avenue is essentially a four-lane river of fast-moving cars. You will wait a long time (clocked it at five minutes once) before the pedestrian-activated crosswalk lights grant you passage. Don't even think about jaywalking as there is a curved portion of the street just west of the hotel where you can't see anything coming until it's too late. All in all, we never spend much time in the hotel on trips and if you are more interested in getting out and enjoying the city rather than lounging in the room, this is an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & cheap for Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: moss87
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 2 years ago, so when me and my boyfriend decided to go to LA this year we booked again. It was exactly the same as before really - the lobby looks fantastic and the rooms are a little dated (they should probably get round to refurbishing them soon). But overall it's a nice place to stay. You are right on the Hollywood Walk of Fame, and if you drive then most places are less than 10/15 minutes away. The rooms are really big and were cleaned everyday. There is a nice pool and sunbathing area, and also an underground parking area which is really secure and also free! If you want an amazing place to stay then I wouldn't recommend, but if like us you didn't want to spend ridiculous amounts on accommodation and more on shopping then this place is definitely worth staying!

Reviews.Title: “Room was dirty and old”
Reviews.Author: yes2tennis
Reviews.Content: When I stayed earlier this year (February), the tiny shower had mold and mildew. So, this time (July) I asked for a different room with a clean shower. They gave me a different room, but the tiny shower still had mold and mildew. Still worse, the hot water in the shower came out only as a trickle. A great place if you want to take only cold showers in a dirty venue. Also there was no ice cube tray in the small refrigerator in February and again in July. If the rooms were as clean as the lobby, this would be a good place. I suggest you check out the bathroom BEFORE you sign on the dotted line.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DouroTraveller
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here while doing a quick weekend in LA. The location of this hotel was amazing - just a block from Hollywood Blvd. The lobby of the hotel is absolutely beautiful - obviously just renovated. The pool and garden are also lovely. The rooms themselves were a little outdated and smelled slightly weird. However, they were spacious and included a kitchen that we used to cook a meal. I also enjoyed sitting on the balcony and enjoying the weather. I would definitely say that this motel is a great value and would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Unsanitary/Filthy/ RUDE MANAGEMENT”
Reviews.Author: never_again01
Reviews.Content: What can I say ? I was referred to this place twice! First time, the 1 bedroom kitchenette my companion had the bed room and I had a hide a bed. We got there mid day and the room STUNK! Burns in the cushions, mold in the shower, light bulbs burnt out and the cups in the kitchens? Also growing! It looked like the cookware has not been washed from the last guest. My stay last week, I thought I would give the hotel another chance. The first room they offered us, the beds although firm, squeaked like the springs need oil. My companion requested that we changed rooms. We were moved down the hall to a room with little better furniture and the beds did not make a sound, however the upstairs guests did. The hygiene of the bathroom was less than acceptable, too. Mold and mildew around the base of the shower, the drain plate coming off the floor and holes in the wals where to pipes are. Furthermore, the shower is so small, there is barely enough room to turn around! When I walked out to their patio, all the furniture was in considerable disrepair and I found that out the hard way! When dealing with the hotel manager over the phone, he was nothing but rude and insulting saying that I had signed a waiver which released the hotel from any liability or accident which may occur on the property . So the only real draw to this place is that Janice Joplin died there (and to my understanding, other guests have drowned in their pool) If your standards are low, and like paying over-inflated rates for what you get, this is your place. Also, no free wi-fi! If you are concerned about cleanliness and a well maintained property stay across the street at the Hollywood Celebrity hotel. Spacious rooms (including the bathroom and shower) friendly, unpretentious atmosphere, and you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Nice VFM hotel”
Reviews.Author: madbullram
Reviews.Content: Well, I stayed in this hotel for 2 weeks. I would say the hotel is nice but nothing great. The staff are very polite and helpful. Pros: Fully equipped kitchen (it might miss some utensils ask the frotn desk) LOCATION (just 1 min walk to Hollywood Blvd) Good deals on the nightly rates Cons: They renovated it but the rooms look very old and archaic TV is aged and channels suck Laundry room sucks even more No b/f

Reviews.Title: “Met my soulmate!”
Reviews.Author: okiemama1
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed for a weekender a while ago and we thought the vintage feel of the hotel was great and when I walked outside the back I felt like I had stepped into paradise never having been to a warm climated place like the westcoast. The room was not so totally awesome...if I were renovating...I would do it correctly and not leaving it looking like the Jesus House. I didn't feel like it was terribly clean and maybe someone should call the health dept just to check... However! one of the best days of my life was meeting my husband at the Knitting Factory and talking to him for the first four hours in that beautiful, very very romantic garden...sigh! We would like to revisit it in the future. But I have to say...if I hadn't met my everything there...I wouldn't go back. I love the garden but I wouldn't be so sure of the cleanliness...and the rates were crazy!!!! Maybe I'm just from the midwest and I'm not used to those insane prices but I would say it was worth $39/night. TOPS! But of course my experience was priceless...<3

Reviews.Title: “loved the experience!”
Reviews.Author: dmaat
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel within walking distance of Hollywood Blvd. and the walk of fame and this was- less than 10 minutes top. The staff was kind and helpful -even when we pulled in at 2 AM after a late night concert and pizza run! We loved the room and the kitchenette with full sized refrigerator; stove; microwave; kitchen table and chairs and even dishes,glasses and flatware! The breakfast in the morning was good for us-coffee; juice; muffins; bagels and cream cheese. And right there by the front door. Loved the 24 hour coffee! Plenty of room for your clothes,etc. in the room. And we thought the room was really spacious and clean. We felt safe walking around even at night, and had no worries about our vehicle. Free parking is a great plus in Hollywood! We have already said that when we visit Hollywood again, we plan on staying longer and taking advantage of the pool, ping pong table and very enjoyable atmosphere here.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: ADELA5
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 3 bedroom suite. Most of it was old and dirty. They say that it comes with full kitchen, in your dreams. Basics were missing: no plates, no cups. Air conditioning in the master bedroom did not work. Full bathroom's door lock did not work, with tree different families in the same suite. Second bathroom was only 1/2 bath. Towels were old, dirty and very rough, like a sand paper. Pool was dirty. And our car was hit by the gate while entering the parking area. And when all this was addressed with the hotel manager, she did nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth It”
Reviews.Author: OttawaTravelsAround
Reviews.Content: I was sent to this hotel courtesy of another one which had overbooked. The staff were quite courteous, the lobby was gorgeous and it could not be closer to Gruman's Theatre and other Hollywood landmarks. Having said all that, the room was disgusting: the furniture was old, the bedroom was hot and musty (air conditioning did not reach there), and the maid had not even removed the soap used by the previous occupants. When we went to use the pool, we were given towels with dried blood on them. If you can put up with all that, you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Tour69
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is Great! Highland Gardens captures the Charm and Lore (ask about Janis Joplin) of Old Hollywood. Lush Inner Courtyard & Pool and Large Rooms, Newly Renovated in 2008, Europeans will Love it! The newly remodeled Front Lobby has Elements of the Getty. Secure underground parking and Large Closets make your stay a pleasure. Great location, walking distance to everything, next to the Magic Castle and only 100 meters from the Heart of Hollywood, the “Walk of Fame” and Grauman's Chinese Theater. For the Price, You can’t beat it !

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a joke!”
Reviews.Author: chevy52
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not at all as it appears from their website. They claim to have a lot of things that real hotels have like iron board, hairdryer, breakfast and internet. We had none of these. The room was old and worn out. The towels and sheets had spots on them. The bath had a severe fungus attack, which triggered my asthma. The balcony door was coming apart, and could hartly be poened. When asking about the complementary internet, since my laptop didn't pick up any network, I was told that since Hollywood is in a valley, the internet sometimes does not work, and that he thought that my laptop was the problem. Next morning the wi-fi was running but I had to pay additional $10 to get online. Not unusual but you should not advertise complementary internet. The complementary continental breakfast, was the biggest joke. They offered free coffee and tea, and a small pastry in a plastic bag. Nothing continental about that. The really nice looking garden (from the website pictures) and the pool area had empty beer bottles scattered around. The pool was filled with debris, and the parking garage was filled with garbage too. It put a dark shade on our visit to LA, and we couln't wait to get out of there. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience.....”
Reviews.Author: GK_ST
Reviews.Content: The owners and staff are amazing, very very helpful and made me and my friend feel at home. This hotel is a piece of Hollywood history in an amazing location, right off the Hollywood strip, behind the Kodak Theatre, a very convenient location close to anything you will ever need. If you are looking for a simple, no frills, comfortable place to stay, then you have found it. I found the hotel to have a unique charm, unlike any of the other hotels in the area. I feel that if you want to experience Hollywood, you really must include a stay at this hotel. The room I stayed in was very large, clean and very comfortable and it came at a great no non-sense rate. I would gladly stay there again on my next visit to Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Be Afraid, Be Very Afraid”
Reviews.Author: lablimo
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for one night and it was one night too long. The only reason we booked this place was it was close to a show we were attending at the Knitting Factory. We knew it was not a luxurious hotel, but for $135+ a night, we expected better. The slider door to the balconey did not lock. The doorknob on the bathroom door was very loose and looked like it was going to fall off. The pipe in the shower where the shower head is attached was rotten and exposed. The refrigerator did not work. The towels were thin, small and rough. There were no irons, hair dryers -- nothing. Also, we were told we were in a "renovated room". I'd hate to see what an old room looked like! The gentlemen who checked us in was, however, very nice. He let our friends (who would be meeting us later) park in the hotel garage while we attended our evening event. We appreciated that very much. This place is creepy -- I would never stay here again, nor would I recommend it to anyone! If you want a cheap, run down place that is close to Hollywood Blvd., and all it has to offer, -- then this is your place, but don't expect much at all. We found the hotel to be creepy, old, dirty and run down.

Reviews.Title: “Service was EXCELLENT, correction.. OUTSTANDING!!”
Reviews.Author: 999Mike
Reviews.Content: If you plan on staying in Hollywood I strongly recommend you consider the Highland Gardens. The property is spacious, but the real experience is the staff. All were exceptional raising the service level comparable, if not exceeding that of many 4- and 5-star hotels I have stayed at. I had requested a flower be placed in the room for my lady with a card. Honestly did not expect it to be there, but it was. Further, the room was heated for our comfort so upon arrival we simply kicked back. And the front desk staff went far out of their way for our unique and frequent requests. While the accomodations are not extremely luxurious, they were spacious and economical.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: triwinner
Reviews.Content: Great location and cheap prices for the area. My wife and I stayed here for two nights because of the close proximity to the magic castle. We booked a one BR suite for around $170/night through Hotels.com. I had driven by the location many times over the years and had never really thought too much about it. I knew that the property is owned by the same people that own the Magic Castle Hotel next door and the Chinese restaurant up the hill. When we first drove up, my wife mentioned that this place is a dump and there was no way she was going to sleep here. I said that we really do not have much of a choice at this point. We did get a parking space right next to the front door. Walking into the lobby, we did not feel much better. The lobby was right out of the 1950’s, and I do not think that it had been cleaned since then. There was a customer at the front desk inquiring about a future stay. I am not kidding – she was at the counter for over an hour talking to the clerk while we had to wait. I felt like Nick Cage in Honeymoon in Vegas. When we were finally waited on, the clerk mentioned that our room would not be ready for another hour. We decided to walk down to Hollywood Blvd and have lunch. By the time we were back, the room was ready. After getting our key and walking out the back door of the lobby, I was shocked. The place is beautiful. It was like Dorothy stepping out of her house into Oz. There were beautiful flowers and landscaping everywhere, with a nice pool in the middle. Our suite was on the first floor and it had just been remodeled. We had a full kitchen with granite counter tops. New furniture throughout. Everything was clean and new. My only complaint was that there was no TV in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “A bit creepy...”
Reviews.Author: poptart78
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Expedia, purely for it's location - it's only a couple of blocks away from Hollywood Boulevard and the Chinese Theatre, Walk of Fame, Kodak Theatre etc. When we first arrived I got a shock - the outside is so dated, run down and shabby....I was expecting better but had been advised that Hollywood hotels can be dodgy as it's not such a great area. The lobby isn't much better to be honest - I don't think the hotel has been decorated since the sixties and it shows. For some this may be appealing, and I must admit it gives the place a certain charm, but it's not what I like in a hotel! After we had struggled up the stairs with our cases, we found our room and were pleasantly suprised - it was clean and farly large. Again it was a bit dated- I'd say probably decorated around 10yrs ago, which is practically new compared to the rest of the hotel. We only used the hotel as a base and it was an excellent location, although as two young women we did feel a little nervous walking back up the road from Hollywood Boulevard late at night as there were lots of homeless people about. We were making each other jumpy enough and then we found the room number where Janis Joplin died...and could hear strange noises through the door...this was really unnerving and spooked us for the whole of our stay!!! The combination of this, the quietness of the hotel and the old fashioned decor really gave me the creeps and I don't think I could stay there again. Fine if you just need a base for a couple of days and don't mind the spooky atmosphere, but think I'll try the Roosevelt next time...if I ever return, as Hollywood was something of a disappointment, aside from the Pig and Whistle restaurant which was fab.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Faith69_dot_com
Reviews.Content: While this hotel only gets 2 out of 5 stars from another review site, we give it 4 out of 5 stars!! The hotel is a bit older, but the interior of the rooms are very spacious, clean, and have all the amenities plus some that I look for in hotel! For the price, they are a perfect stay while you are in hollywood. I don't think you will find anything better, unless you move up to the super expensive five star hotels. Our room had two beds, a huge closet and bathroom area, full kitchen and dining table... would be perfect for a family or a group of friends spending a few days in Hollywood! And the parking is included with your room! Most other hotels in the area are charging you additional for the parking! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Hollywood!! Super close to all the popular bars and hollywood destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: Persia69
Reviews.Content: Old, tired and dirty. The card for our room did not work, the room hadn't been cleaned when we arrived and over the next three days the maid come at 4pm to tidy up. No room safe and it was easy to climb our balcony to get in as the door didn't lock. The best of all was the bedbugs. Nothing like going home with itchy bites all over your face and arms. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Georgeann
Reviews.Content: My sister and I found this property to be a safe, clean, inexpensive hotel close to Hollywood Blvd. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Yes, it is an old 1950's hotel and the hallway carpeting and lighting gave a shabby first impression until we stepped into our room. Fresh carpet, paint, bedding, and fixtures and a kitchen! We could sit out on the patio just outside our room and smell the dozens of rose bushes, and many other beautiful plants. The pool was clean as was the walkways. The parking garage, which was underground, was no extra charge. There is coffee brewing in the lobby at all times, an ATM machine and two computer terminals. It was a few minutes to Burbank and Warner Bros., Universal, and NBC studios and only a block from the Chinese Theater, Walk of the Stars, Kodak Center, etc. and minutes to Sunset Strip, Beverly Hills and Rodeo Drive. We would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay, great price”
Reviews.Author: wildrage
Reviews.Content: Before I write my review, let me say that I'm a 25 year-old male, and stayed at the Highland Gardens with my 21-year old brother. We were looking for a place that was cheap and in a good location. We do not demand hotels that have aromatherapy lotions, flat screen plasma TV's, etc. We stayed at the Highland Gardens from April 20 to April 26. This being said, the Highland Garden hotel is only a block away from Hollywood Blvd., and a 5 minute walk from Mann's Chinese Theater. The rooms were clean and simple. The decor probably hasn't been updated from the late 70's. I thought that this was all pretty cool, but others may not. We stayed in an 'executive suite' with 2 queen beds, a pretty large ktichen, changing room, and bathroom. The rooms had very large, nearly 'walk-in' closets, tons of dressers, etc. I was very satisfied with the size of the room and the cleanliness of the room. It's true, it could probably need a fresh coat of paint, new drapery, etc., but for the money you can't beat it. Each room has a sliding glass door with a little porch or balcony overlooking the central courtyard, which is fully enclosed by gates. The only way to get to this courtyard is by either passing by the front desk, or from one of the rooms. Their is no outside access. As for the parking garage, I thought it was excellent! It is dark, but the only way to get in is by buzzing the front desk from your car. There are video camera's all over the place, and they verify that you're a guest and automatically 'open the gate.' It is a little creapy down there, but when you realize that theres no way for anyone else to get in, and that there are camera's everywhere, you get over it. In summary, this hotel isn't the Hilton, but if you like a small hotel with tons of nostalgia at a great location for a great price, I would recommend the Highland Gardens whole-heartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Fine as long as you don't spend all your time in your room”
Reviews.Author: XtinaLady1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent a week at this hotel and had a perfectly good stay. Ok, I was also a little miffed as to why the disinterested receptionist wanted my card for a $100 deposit, but I asked the right questions and got the right answers. I would suggest that anyone who stays here & is faced with this predicament, do asks for a valid receipt; it would save hassle later. The rooms themselves were very large, with two double beds. Our room was on the 2nd floor and overlooked the pool; a perfectly nice retreat. However, it was a srtuggle getting upstairs & the receptionist wasn't fazed by the image of the two staggering with many bags and suitcases. But i suppose 'porter' wasn't in his job title. We didn't let this bother us. The only problems we had with the room was 1. the lack of lighting and even then the owner was keen to oblige in putting in a new bulb. He was very accommodating. And 2. The so-called 'continental breakfast' wasn't worth mentioning in the hotels description (a danish to me isn't a breakfast!) The location however, couldn't be better. It's within walking distance to all the great landmarks; Beverly Hills, Hollywood Blvd, Manns Chinese theatre & even the Hollywood/Highland metro station is just minutes away. The latter provides links to all corners of the city & it's so cheap to travel! It's brilliant! Taxis aren't even that expensive here. We spent one lovely afternoon by the pool & saw it being tested etc and although it was rather on the chilly side, it wasn't bone achingly cold! It was nice the chill out for an afternoon; after the hectic daytrips and long evenings. This was the only time we really stayed at the hotel. The rest of the time it was solely used as a base. Here's a few pointers to those who plan to stay here; * Don't judge on appearance; the outside decor is not particularly attractive or interesting, but inside there's far more character. Be warned this isn't to everyones taste! * Remember what you paid - and I believe you do get what you pay for * Ask for a receipt for that deposit *And make use of the free internet access in the lobby & the pool. Would I stay here again? Yes I would! There is no-way I could find a better location for the same price. As long as you're not planning to spend the whole or most of your trip at the hotel I think you'll be fine! ~Hope this helps~

Reviews.Title: “Motel Hell”
Reviews.Author: karenvegas
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 4 night stay in this place. I took my niece for her first trip to the US and this is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. My heart sank when I saw the lobby! The man on reception was ignorant . He asked me for my credit card and then gave me a receipt for $100. I asked him what this was for and he said it was a deposit. He didnt even ask if he could take it. Then when I asked him where the safe was he smirked and said there wasn't one. He then said there was one but everyone could use it!!!I said "are you saying that I can use the safe but other people could take my stuff". He grinned and said yes. I was really cross. Our room was on the ground floor. The patio door lock was not very secure and it was very creepy at night. It had not been decorated this century by the look of it. The only good thing about it was that the bed was comfortable. Water was coming through the bathroom ceiling during our stay. When I told him he just said "oh" I said dont you want to check it out and he did reluctantly. He said the people upstairs had ran too much water in the bath!!!!!The surrounding area was safe at night.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this dump!”
Reviews.Author: 231Richardson
Reviews.Content: Creepy! I stayed here in early 2005. Worst place I've ever (not ) slept. My room was right behind the check-in desk. It had originally been the Night Manager's room, but they'd re-modeled it and were renting it out as a regular room. Like one of the other guests' review, one wall of my room was a sliding glass door that wouldn't lock. The cement courtyard echos and amplifies every sound (including the 4 rowdy "Dudes" who came in drunk at 2 AM. You have to buzz the front desk to be let in to the undergroud garage -- and I heard every one: at 12, 2 and 3 AM. I'm a grown man and didn't feel safe -- (I took my luggage with me whenever I left the room ) I checked out the next morning and let them keep my 2nd night's rent. Just wasn't worth it. Stay away from this dump!

Reviews.Title: “A total disappontment - stay away”
Reviews.Author: Dravid2
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews and looking at the hotels website we decided this would be the perfect place for us to start and finish our holiday. How wrong were we. Upon arrival the lobby told its own story. The carpet and stair carpet were absolutely soiled and appeared not to have been cleaned foe many a month. The receptionist just went through the motions of asking me to complete the paperwork. Now for the room. What a disgrace. Two of the doors had holes where it appeared someone had punched them, chewing gum stuck in the carpets and the so called air conditionong unit just covered in dust and fluff. The wardrobes and drawers smelt and were dirty. The bathroom and kitchen no better. We immediately complained and were offered another room. This was not much better but a little cleaner. Unfortunately on the bedroom window we had the lovely view of a climbing plant very much dead. The bedroom lamp was not working whereupon I had to change the bulb myself. As it was late we decided to stay has we had no real choice. The next morning checked the cupboards in the kitchen and found leftover food from previous occupants. As for the so called breakfast included in the price was nowhere to be found. Finally discovered it by the complimentary coffee, a danish pastry!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! We were to return for another 5 nights but this was cancelled without hesitation. The staff were totallly unhelpful and appeared to have a couldn't care less additude. Even when checking out I had to ask the receptionist to move their own car that was blocking the only exit to the road. All in all a total disappointment and I could not recommend this hotel to any other traveller until it has undergone a total overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: phelnere
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about a five minute walk away from the heart of hollywoods attractions. It would be tough to find a better location if that is where you want to hang out. One of the previous posters described the operation as having an "old school" mentality. They are absolutely correct. It is a family run operation and the owners are actively involved. They are nice people, and very accomodating. There is nothing fancy about the place, and if you expect everything to be perfect, go somewhere else, and pay alot more. My only criticism is that there were areas of the hotel that could have been cleaner, and some that should have been repainted. I think the problem is that they have been running the place for so long, they don't notice the deficiencies...ie, cobwebs in the lobby, dirty stairs leading down to the garage parking area, to name a few. These things didn't bother me all that much, but would drive others to distraction. Many of the guests come back year after year because of the value, and if value is important to you over substance, you will enjoy your stay. The area is generally safe, parking is free, and there is coffee/tea and a pastry available each morning....also free.

Reviews.Title: “It was fine...really!”
Reviews.Author: missrocky
Reviews.Content: This is a VERY old school hotel...Very old 1950's Hollywood. They have redone the rooms and they're fine...really. If I were the owner, I would have made it more 1950's kitchy instead of motel 6...it would have been a great angle for the place considering it has such history...Janis Joplin died there and I was entertaining a music fan from out of town- so it was a thrill to be there... The staff was great! They owed me 3 cents change from when I paid for the room the night before...and they had it waiting for me with a note of apology. I really didn't care about the 3 cents- but it was very cool for them to do that and I have actually kept the pennies and the note because I thought it was such great customer service. Pros: the room was very clean and quiet It's close to the fwy and major tourist traps Great hollywood pictures in the lobby Cons: Parking garage is DARK and a little scary No elevators- so pack light! If you get a room in the corner of the hotel that over looks an alley, you may have a homeless guy staring back at you. If the wind picks up, you'll smell urine from the alley (so don't get a room that over looks the alley and you'll be fine). If you're looking for the RITZ- well, this isn't the RITZ. If you want to have a very clean room, nothing fancy and be in a SAFE part of Hollywood- this hotel will work!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but!”
Reviews.Author: octopussy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Higland Gardens for five nights in August with our two children. The location is fantastic for that part of town (two blocks from the Chinese theatre, Kodak theatre, Hollywood walk of fame etc. It's also within easy reach of Beverly Hills, West Hollywood, Westwood and Santa Monica. However, the hotel's not great and although we'd emailed prior to our visit and asked for a renovated room we never received a reply. It may have been because the better rooms cannot accommodate four people. On arrival our room smelled so bad that the children wouldn't even enter! We asked to change but they didn't have anything else. We had to buy a room spray and plug-in but they didn't make much difference. Although the room was probably clean it didn't feel it i.e. the carpet was stained and the bathroom was rusty all around the bath. Also they state that there are hairdryers in the room but you have to ask for one from reception. This isn't a problem as long as they haven't all been loaned out. One big plus was free parking and the staff were friendly. Also internet access in the lobby was very convienent. It was great having a laundry room too. Would I stay there again - probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Very Scary.. Cheap is not better.. Avoid this place!!”
Reviews.Author: cootercheeks
Reviews.Content: Literally this was the worst experience I've had in a hotel... So bad that it cost us $100.00 for the night and we checked out at 1:30am... (didn't even make it through the whole night). We checked in and learned that the hotel's parking was below the bulding.. (Not a big deal) except in the 1950's when the hotel was built there was no elevator installed.. Kinda makes it rough to carry 6 bags of luggage up stairs. We checked in to our (newly remodeled room).. What a joke.. The sliding glass doors were not even locked when we got to the room. When I tried to locked them, it was close to impossible.. The air conditioner never did work.. I guess the dirty occilating fan was suppoed to blow dirty warm air on us in the night. The freshly painted closet doors that would not close was aweful nice and the rock hard bed made me wonder if the bum I spotted on Fairfax was going to get a better night's rest them I was. As the night approached we learned that half the lights in the room never worked (I had to let the front desk give me bulbs to install myself) and then the creepy moaning and taping on our windows made for a nice sleeping conditions. Within one hour of this experience, we checked out immediatly and found a very nice hotel up the road. Maybe Janis Joplin is still there in spirit? Creepy!! Would not recommend to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable accomodations in a great location”
Reviews.Author: KGill
Reviews.Content: My 8-year-old son and I stayed at the Highland Garden Hotel for two weekday nights in August 2006. We weren't expecting to spend much time in our room, but wanted a place with a pool where we could also get a good night's sleep. This hotel did not disappoint. We had reserved a room with two beds, and the room we got also included a kitchen - I don't know if every room has one, or if we were upgraded for some reason (we paid $99/night). We specifically requested a renovated room, as suggested by other reviewers, and I would strongly recommend that other visitors do the same. PROS: - super location. Within easy walking distance of the major Hollywood sights, and the Hollywood/Highland metro station. We took the metro to Universal Studios to avoid traffic and parking issues. - big swimming pool. I'm not sure if it is heated - it was a bit chilly when we tried it, but that didn't stop us from going in. - free parking. We used one of the spaces in front of the hotel - parallel parking required - instead of the garage. - large room. It did not feel crowded at all, and was larger than most hotel rooms I've stayed in. The large balcony was nice, too. CONS: - no clock in the room. Not one, anywhere. Bring your own alarm clock if you need one. - no voice mail on the phone. My cell phone battery ran out during our trip, so I would have appreciated having voice mail on the hotel phone. I suppose someone could leave a message at the front desk. - the hotel is showing its age. Even in the renovated rooms, you ccan tell you're in an older building. It didn't really matter to me, but it might be important to some people. Incidentally, on expedia.com it says that continental breakfast is included in their rate. The hotel does not have any dining facilities at all, so I can't imagine how they could offer continental breakfast. There is a pot of foul-looking coffee in the lobby at all times, though. For the money, this is a convenient, comfortable place to stay. It is not geared toward businesspeople at all (no alarm clock, no voice mail, no business center), but would be good for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood hits a highspot with Highland gardens hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinghydame
Reviews.Content: Recently I brought a group of Special Olympic swimmers to California for a vacation and stayed at the Higland Gardens. What a great experience for all! We were a group of ten and after talking with the manager Jim decided our best bet would be to stay in a couple of suits. Traveling from Massachusetts we only had the web site (which is excellent,) and Jim to walk us through what our accomadations would be. We were not dissapointeed. All of the staff were very friendly, helpful and charming. The hotel built in 1957 had all the charm of classic mid-century California architecture with a courtyard pool. Our suites were newly remodeled, large and clean. The large three bedroom had a bath and a half, full kitchen, dining area, pull out sofa and a balcony overlooking the pool. The grounds were lush with flowering trees and vegatation, very pretty. Highland Gardens is located on Franlin Ave. one block north on Hollywood Blvd. (Hollywood walk of Fame) and one block east of LaBrea, making it central to all the Hollywood sights and major roadways. We loved our stay at the Highland Gardens and can't thank Jim and his staff enough for making our trip of a lifetime a great one. Cindy Lull

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodaions at very reasonable prices.”
Reviews.Author: Magic/Appreciation
Reviews.Content: The Highland Gardens Hotel is located on Franklin Avenue in Hollywood just North of Hollywood Blvd. & next to the Magic Castle Hotel. If you have the occasion to visit the area to enjoy the many attractions in the area I would highly recommend this establishment. Their rates are considerably less than the hotel next door & their accommodations are very comparable. Clean & comfortable lodgings. During my stay there I found the hotel staff to be very accommodating, curious & helpful. I was very surprised to learn that they were undergoing renovations during my stay. I didn't see or hear any disruption that usually accompanies this types of activity. When I cheked out I was given a thank you note with an offer of a special "Loyalty Rate" for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “70's style, but great location”
Reviews.Author: vmax
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a 70's look, but it's great value for money and the location is great. It's located nly one block away from the Sunset Boulevard with it's Walk of Fame etc. We were only staying for two days and didn't try the pool. There were some homeless people hanging across the street from the hotel, but they never bothered us. Seemed like some of them lived in cars parked in the area (!). The rooms were big and ok but could have been upgraded, but it's cheap and all in all gives good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad after all”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are staying here for 8 nights in a one bed room suite (upstairs). After all the reviews here, we were a bit worried and had double booked the last 4 nights, just in case. After one night here we cancelled the other hotel. The pool does have a grimey line just above the water, but the water itself is refreshing, and we've seen the staff clean the filter and pour chlorine in. There are some dry leaves in the garden, but hey, this is California in July. There are squirrels and humming birds. The room is clean enough - you get black feet if barefoot on the balcony. The sheets and towels are crisp and clean. We get service every day - they change the towels even if we don't put them on the floor. The utensils, plates, glasses etc in the kitchen were clean, and the fridge+freezer seem rather new. The suite has a high ceiling and feels spaceous. TV works fine. We had a clogged sink in the kitchen, which they came and fixed right away. With Graumann's Chinese 1 block away, free parking and cooking possibilities, I'd say this place is well worth the money. There may be other rooms with poorer quality, but ours is very OK.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant experience for a decent price”
Reviews.Author: mini_tako
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend. The room was acceptable. It had a slight musty smell, but was very clean. The bathroom was renovated but very tiny- the shower stall was extremely tiny and the water pressure was not acceptable. However, it was a safe, clean, and very conveniently located. If you are planning to spend most of your time on Melrose, Hollywood Blvd, or Sunset Blvd, this is a good choice. The overall look and feel of the hotel was very reminescent of old Hollywood. Hotel would be perfect with a major renovation. Personally, I would not stay there again, but recommend to those looking for a low budget weekend trip and won't be staying in hotel most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “very pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: NoodlePatricia
Reviews.Content: After reading all the other reviews, I was a bit nervous to check into the Highland Gardens. I requested a remodeled room in the back, per the suggestions of the other reviewers and couldn't have been happier with the room (#123). It was an apartment. Full kitchen, separate bedroom, new furniture, new tiles in the bathroom, everything was perfectly clean. If you want the luxuries of a fancy hotel, don't stay there, but if you're looking for lots of room, cleanliness and comfort for a low price, stay at the Highland Gardens. A lot of people stay here long term, so those little luxuries aren't included (ie nice comforter, fluffy towels) I did notice some of the rooms that hadn't been remodeled were not so nice, but the front desk is extremely helpful and accomodating, so just request it when making your reservation. I did not go swimming, but the pool looked clean and nice. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for nice budget accomodations with room to move. Perfect for people staying a week or so and interested in having the ability to snack or make meals. Interesting case of characters that stay there, but completely 100% safe and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all! Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews on trip advisor i was expecting the worst... but i can only say it was not bad at all. Considering the price and the location this is probably one of the best deals you can find. Our room (room 104) was probably just refurbished and was clean and spacious. However i did see some of the rooms which were not refurbished and in the old condition and those looked horrible! (but during our stay they were actually working on some other rooms which probably means they re-do all the rooms step by step) The hotel looks a bit old and the reception was not very friendly (except for the asian night receptionist who was very friendly)... but our room was perfect!! There is no bar or restaurant, but our room had a small kitchen with a large fridge and the vending machine did have snacks and drinks. It was nice to be able to sit on a small veranda for our room and it was very pleasant to enjoy the sun at the pool area. All i can say is that we had a very good stay of 6 nights and next time i probably would go there again (but i would advice to ask for a new room!).

Reviews.Title: “Dont go near room 203”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. We had travelled from San Francisco over the past 10 days and were really looking forward to unpacking and relaxing for a few days before moving on again. However we were given room 203 which faced the road. I was horrified when I opened the door. The room was digusting to say the least. The walls were marked, the walk way through the wardrobes to the bathroom was well!!!! The plug sockets were loose so I dared not plug anything in. It was a health and safety hazzard. We immediately complained and asked to be moved but as the hotel was allegedly full they could do nothing about it although we could try again next day. Still no luck. The lady on the desk was not very helpful and appeared not to care. I never unpacked. However on day 3 we were given another room which was lovely, although this was for 1 night only but we took it anyhow. Next day we were told we would have to move so we were given room 201 which was next door to the original room but oh what a difference. I would not recommend it to anyone else unless you could request a referbished room. Incidentally the Asian restaurant up the hill behind the hotel was excellent and well worth a booking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: pokahonta
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an excellent location on a budget, this is the place. It's within walking distance of popular attractions (Kodak theatre, Grauman's Chinese Theatre,Hollywood Walk of Fame, etc.) The place looks old and not so pretty, but al least it's clean. Don't recommend to stay in the rooms near the street. I will recommend this hotel if you are looking for a place to shower and spend the night.

Reviews.Title: “70's Nostalgia”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know when the Highland Gardens had it's last renovation but it definitely felt like a time warp. If the names: Jack, Janet & Chrissy give you warm fuzzies you'll probably dig this pad. My room had all the basics (bed, bath, couch, tv) and some extras (full kitchen and view of the pool). Rumor has it Janis Joplin died here (when it was called the Landmark Hotel, Room 105). I enjoyed the "experience" but would recommend you look elsewhere for luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have gone to this hotel twice now and both times we were treated as if we were movie stars. The owner even moved his car for us to have somewhere to park up front last year. The rooms are being re-done so they were even prettier this year. The guests and staff are always very friendly. The grounds and pool are very well taken care of. Weather you take the family, just you and a friend, or even just yourself with a good book this is the place to be for just a quiet night or a night of site seeing.

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for the Ritz. . .”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: . . . then stay at the Ritz. If you want the Chateau then stay at the Chateau. If you want the Beverly Hills Hotel then make a reservation. But if you want to stay a week for the cost of one night in the Mondrain or any of the other area Hollywood hotels, have a suite with a kitchen, have one of the most beautiful pools in Hollywood to swim in and sun around, free underground parking, free wired internet (wireless costs 29.99 a month but coverage is almost full reception all over the property) a balcony which gives you a place to sit and relax, smoke, have a drink and unwind at the end of a long day, then the Highland Gardens is a great choice. This hotel holds much of the history that is Hollywood. Brad Pitt lived here. Janis Joplin died here. This is a hotel where dreams are born for those who want to be the next big star. And you will see stars at this hotel. I've stayed many times and have seen the likes of Jeffery Jones, Jeff Goldblum, Eddie Murphy, Axel Rose and others. The rooms are big, really big comparatively for any other hotels. The hotel is easily accessible from the street. It is a hotel for business people and familys. The owners are Hollywood natives, they have relationships with all the services someone staying from out of town needs, black car, cab, area club and restarant reservations etc. This is a family owned and operated hotel. It was definately "old" at one point and needed a remodel. Well it is getting it. When I reserve a room I always ask if it one of the remodelled ones. Fresh paint, tile floors, new furniture, TV's in everyroom, and better lighting. Everything is fine here for the money. I'm tired of listenting to people trash this hotel. I've never seen any of the horrific things people post on this site. Cigarette butts in beds?!? Ridiculous! As for the post about rude staff, I think most everywhere staff in hotels are considered rude if they don't respond to you immediately. If you want to experience rude staff then stay at a haute hotel for $390.00+ per night and get attitude from a hotel employee who decided since you don't drive a Rolls Royce you're not alive. So if you want a night or a week, remember it's not the Ritz, it is what it is. I'd rather stop at Ralphs, (right around the corner) then pay Ian Schrager or Andre Balaz $25.00 for a drink or cashews. If you're a real person looking for a real hotel in the heart of Hollywood the Highland Gardens is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot on business so most of the time I am away from home. Staying at the Highland Gardens didn't make me feel I'm away from home. It is not a five star hotel but it sure has its charm. Unlike other hotels where you feel boxed in, this hotel gives you the feeling of so much space. Having a room with a balcony facing the pool and garden is just perfect for relaxation after a day of meetings. The hotel staff were great. I would definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surpised!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WOW!!!! I was pleasantly surprised after reading the previous reviews. My brother and I were looking for a hotel close to everything since we wanted to sightsee and we didn't have a car and I have to tell you this place was perfect for us. The pool area was so beautiful (Though too cold outside to swim, we read our paper there every morn). We stayed in a pretty new looking room and it was very clean and bright. But, what I really liked was the staff. They could not have been nicer. The woman at the front desk was sooooo sweet to us (she has longish dark hair, very pretty). She had tons of information about things to see and do. And there were several people on t.v. there! This was our first time in LA and we were a little star struck as we are from Portland and it's cool to see someone in your hotel that you saw on t.v. the week before. Anyway, the price was very reasonable and the people were very helpful. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Great pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a remodeld suite which was brand new. It was near the pool very quite and very large for a hotel. It had a seperate Bedroom and living room, large kitchen and balcony. Everything worked fine. I read some negative reviews on this hotel and yes there are older rooms, in fact our friends who traveled with us had an older room and it was not even close to what we were in. I recommend requesting a newer room off the street. This hotel is very large and has a large pool. If you get a room near the street it wont be like one near the garden or pool, so be sure and request the right room. The location is great. The kodak theater is a block away with a dozen new restaurants and shops along with a new underground metro that you can take anywhere. If you are looking for a new hotel for more money than stay at the Rennasance hotel which is right around the corner, but if you are on a budget like me than this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “What a disgusting dump!”
Reviews.Author: stuart1950
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt the most disgusting hotel we have ever stayed in. If you are daft enough to stay there after reading the reviews make sure that you never take off your shoes and wear gloves wherever possible!! It is filthy and the owners / staff show no interest in the welfare of their guests. When we complained about the standard of the room we were given, the guy opened and showed us rooms occupied by other guests !!!! He had no idea what rooms were in use or what rooms had been `cleaned` and in 1 case the guests were watching TV !!. We had missing floor tiles, lights didn`t work, electrics were in a terrible state, carpet beyond belief, ac sounded like a jet aircraft, pool was awful, no elevator, dim corridors, patio door didn`t lock, awful damp smell .... could go on and on. I have read reviews which give this hotel a mark of 4 out of 5. Take no notice as these must have been written by the staff or those related to the staff. Fortunately we were only there for 2 nights. The homeless had the right idea ... sleep outside on the grass verges ... cleaner and safer. This is a truly nasty place with only 1 redeeming feature which is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Run-down, cheap and grimey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I thought I'd go here because the website made it look better then some of the other dives I've stayed in in Hollywood but boy was I wrong. I tried seven, yes seven, times to change rooms to no avail. The carpet was very old, red high pile from the 60's or 70's that concelled who knows what in it. The beds were very old, concaved and I could feel the springs. I got upset enough that they changed out one of the beds and I had the misfortune of seeing the old box spring and mattress without the bed linens, that was frightening. I spent the first night sleeping with a light on because I was sure the bugs would be crawling out of the woodwork once I went to sleep. My room was also facing Franklin Street which is very noisy. The furniture had cigarette burn marks and I could hardly turn on the lamps above the bed because the knobs were worn and about to break. I stayed here four nights - only because I was attending a conference nearby and I could not find any other hotel availability in the area. Next time I need a cheap sleep I'll opt for the Motel 6 nearby.

Reviews.Title: “what a dump!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: this place is in bad need of remodel r demolision.all the furniture was 20 plus years old. staff was rude .called down for an ash tray clerk said they didnt have any but to smoke anyway?? would not recomend to my worst enemy.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable ..... nothing splashy !!”
Reviews.Author: HumnaHumna
Reviews.Content: Okay, I stayed in this hotel twice and that was a number of years ago. Looking at the reviews, not much has changed. Back when I stayed here (1983 & 1988), it was just acceptable, nothing splashy. Rooms were just acceptable for cleanliness, not sparkling clean, that is for sure; staff was nice enough. The hotel has a nice nostalgic feel to it, like back in the 1940's or 1950's. It is a shame though. With a complete renovation job: total clean up, rip out those ghastly rugs, painting, wallpapering, etc, ....this hotel would be a gem. It is in a good area in Hollywood. When I was there, I got the room at a rather cheap rate, so I wasn't bothered too much by its 'imperfections.' If I had spent big bucks $$$ on the room, THEN I would have been really ticked off. It was okay for budget travellers such as myself, who got it at a reduced price. There aren't many bells, whistles, frills at this place, so don't go expecting any. It is a basic type establishment. Would I stay here again under these same hotel conditions?? Well, I would definately look for somewhere else which was cleaner at a reasonable price. If I couldn't find anything else, then I would stay here again, albeit reluctantly. On both visits, I coincidentally got the SAME room! As for being a spacious room, it was okay. One last note, I found the underground parking garage drab and dull; I personally felt safe enough being a male.... a female may feel otherwise, especially at night. In short: Hotel is okay for the budget traveller who is not picky. ps... Keep in mind I was at this hotel many years ago... this review is just to show you what it was like back then. Many similarities still exist !

HotelInfo.Name: Highland Gardens Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 7047 Franklin Ave., Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90028
